RelatedSentence: A SHORTAGE of nurses poses the biggest risk to the county 's hospital services in the future health chiefs have warned .

Over the next two years the West Midlands will have 1,200 fewer nurses than it needs to meet demand and bosses at Worcestershire Acute Hospitals NHS Trust say they are already feeling the impact with difficulties recruiting .

RelatedSentence: The Trust has turned to overseas nurses to try and fill the gap but some have left because of home sickness while there is an issue with training as the effective discharging of patients is a bigger focus in the NHS than health systems abroad .
